description:
Still come here because it is convenient.  One thing that was different this time was I tried two new items.  Most fast food places I get the same thing  I don't go for new items as they are fad.  I was intrigued by the Chipotle Chicken Fries and the Jumpin Jack Flash drink.

Both are great additions to the menu and very tasty.  The chicken fries had moist and tender pieces of chicken.  They are served with a little guacamole and are best eaten with a fork
author: Erik H.

description: The staff is so slow that it gave criminals enough time in their parking lot to rob the contents of our vehicle. "Jack Ing The Van". For the record, the food wasn't that good for the wait and price.
author: Jason C.

description:
Service was great.  Really quick in getting the orders out and friendly enough too at the same time.  It was the lunch rush when we got there and the line was almost out the door.  We had our food and actually got a table in no time.  There is indoor seating but it is limited.  It's smaller than most JITB's that I've been to, but this is SF and square footage is expensive.
I ordered a club chicken sandwich on sour dough.  The chicken was the strangest texture I've ever encountered.  I thought it might be raw or pink in the middle, but no, white all the way through.  Fries were great, regular and curly.  Drinks were from the new Coke machine with the added flavors if you want.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.  Not knowing any better, it was a quick fix.
author: Reba Jane S.

description: The food is good and the environment is ehh what can I expect. Can take long to get your food if your in a hurry The restrooms are clean and the employees have been friendly so far.
author: Georgiana R.

description: Wtf! Almost $8 for monster taco meal. Jack in the box becomes jackass box? $8 can get me way better taco from an authentic Mexican restaurant; if not, Taco Bell. Only wanted to get from jack in the box because known for cheaper taco even though funky made. Nope! Jack in the box will go down even more now.
author: Max L.

description:
T....h....e        s.....e....r....v....i....c.....e     h.....e.....r.....e      i.....s      i....n....c....r....e.....d.....i....b...l.....y        s.....l......o.......w.    All i ordered was curly fries and they called out number after number before they gave me mine.  This  was at 2 pm on a Sunday. 
Think smarter, not harder.  Sigh.
author: Victor L.

description:
Saturday evening a bit passed midnight.... a packed house. Patrons lined up to the exit door. 

A lonely squished curly fry greets you near tbe door. 

You can always count on this place being open and it is a public service that keeps the bar crowd nurished after they spent most of their disposable income on bars next door.

A number 11 sourdough grilled chicken club sounds good. 

Small outdoor seating area filled with natives that are camping there too long.

People in line debate how many ligitametly crazy people come in during a given night, over or under 3?

Good luck getting a seat at after hours.
author: Stefan T.

description: Horrible service never complete orders right or on time try to call no answer on phone
author: Sean F.

description: This location has been a frequent stopover by me and my friends whenever we go out. Food and service here was simply average but its all good. If they could get better in both, then I would recommend them to others. My last visit here was just yesterday and the employees were a bit more cheery.
author: Patricia B.

description: This place is a 1.6 mile walk from my place and open 24 hours. . I work remotely off hours so I walk down for the exercise in the 11 PM - 4 AM hours occasionally and grab a MEAT LOVERS BREAKFAST BURRITO which is getting up over $5 bucks but solid and fairly consistent. Sometimes toss in a Jumbo Jack for the walk home.
author: Sebastian B.

description:
#firstworkoutrecoveryproblems Emergency #ghost protocols activated on 4am calorie seek x eatstroy missions. You thought I was supposed to eat egg whites, tuna, chicken bressesses* & healthy shizz? Well you're talking to a man whose Stanford running coach used to tell me stories of his 4000 cal #yoquiero Taco Bell runs, sucka. #allabouttheroosevelts #798999 #rsvelts

(^_^) Stacked Grilled Cheeseburger $4
(^_^) Chick-N-Tater Melt $4
(^_^) Sourdough Grilled Chicken Club $6
(-_^) Spicy Sriracha Burger $6
(-_-) Tacos $?
(v_v) Bacon Ranch Monster Taco $2.59

*S'right, beezys: no #oxfordcomma bc oo baby we grammar raw, yeah bebeh we grammar rawwww! #yellowsuits #jesseweneedtocook #ripoldb
author: Dan B.

description: The food was very reasonable ,the pricing exceptional. Good service too. All round fantastic value. It is a fast food chain. The Burger is good.
author: Paige C.

description:
I was walking on Geary Blvd when a stumbled upon a large, black, and surprisingly heavy book on the sidewalk. Titled 'The Playbook' written by one Barney Stinson, the tome was filled with pages and pages of brilliant dating advice. After browsing through chapters such as 'The Lorenzo Von Matterhorn', 'The Scuba Diver', and 'The Robin', I saw a Play that completely captured my imagination:

--

"The Jill in the Box"

1. Find yourself at Would You Believe on Dollar Shot Thursdays. Wear a college sweater from the Southern States, preferably one that no one has heard about. It will make all your odd comments and actions later seem somehow unfamiliarly appropriate. 

2. Look for a girl in a Lupe sweater, as this would indicate that she can handle her Food & Liquor. Offer to buy her a shot. Keep to the $1 menu, of course.

3. Pretend to listen to her problems about her midterm anxieties, her passive aggressive sorority sister, and her boyfriend that never was (who is probably just eight paces away). Mistakenly call her 'Jill' several times while you pretend to console her.

4. Steer the conversation away to drunk munchies. Mention how you sorely miss the East Coast Mom & Pops diner back from home. Take 2 more shots to avoid her look of incredulity when you tell her that the diner is Jack in the Box.

5. Feign a wave of astonishment when she shows you that Jack in the Box is just across the street. Insist that you must take her out for drunk munchies for this revelation.

6. Purchase two $6 munchie box (Spicy Chicken Nacho, Chicken Tater Melt). Insist on paying for both, to which she would most assuredly say, "Then please let me get the next one." Subtly mention that you have not yet tried The House of Prime Rib approximately 3 minutes later.

7. Make up some story about how you and your first love, Jill, used to share Curly Fries all the time, that is until she died an untimely death. Tell the girl that you only bought her a drink because she looks just like Jill and it reminded you too much of your early romance. Apologize and offer to leave. Don't leave. Suck on the jalapenos from the Spicy Chicken Nacho sandwich until you can force a tear. If you fail, a streak of Dr. Pepper down your cheek will have to suffice.

8. Seeing that you're a sensitive gentleman (make sure to still solemnly finish that very delicious burger), she can't help but develop some feelings for you. Allow her to console you, preferably at her place. Never be the one to call the Lyft. It's surge pricing.

--
author: Ringo M.

description: Ordered bacon cheddar potatoes wedges with extra bacon and cheddar. Paid an extra $1.60 for the extras and did not receive it.
author: Jonathan M.

description: The past 2 times I have gone here here after work they have been "closed for maintenance". Even though I have gone there at the same time and got good service numerous times before. What is the deal!? Not planning on going back since I won't be given service at a supposedly 24 hour establishment.
author: Stan J.

description: This Jack in the box is small and has a drive-through menu board outside of the store which is wired considering this location has no drive-through. I came here a couple of time eat dinner. The workers here are nice. The food is good. Noting to complain about. Only four stars because the location is small.
author: Isaac H.

description: Came here around 1:00AM on a Friday night due to nothing else being opened around the area during that time. Service was OK, about 20 minutes to get a simple order of chicken nuggets and fries. Fairly packed with minimal workers.
author: James D.

description:
Super cheap and it's quite tasty if you consider it's fast food and ridiculously cheap. Of course it is extremely unhealthy, but I don't think anyone would come here thinking otherwise. 
The service was super nice, however, I was disapointed they didn't tell me about the $6 meal they had during lunch time. It was basically what I was ordering, but with $0.30 more I'd get some nuggets.
I had the $0.99 two tacos, french fries(big mistake! Go for the curly fries!), a small drink (iced tea), and the 5 mini-churros portion. Everything was really yummy.
author: Andréia S.

description: I used to come here almost every night after working late shift as a dog walker back in 2014. I would even come here to sober up after having consumed a drink at Would You Believe? Cocktails. That was back in 2007. I usually ordered a bacon burger with a chocolate shake. Chocolate is good for the heart! One time, while I for my order, a young man mistook me for someone else. I played along and left the eatery! Good evening and good luck tomorrow!
author: Julio B.

description: Considering so many restaurants in this city have terrible health scores, it's refreshing that this fast food place has 98/100 and no gross infestations. It's cheap and open late so sometimes I'll order through doordash. They never send sauces or the right drink but whatever, good enough. It's great for a cheap burger place.
author: Emma M.

description: this is a review for Tracy!!! great customer service and incredibly friendly! i usually don't go to this jack in the box location but i would come  back  just  for  Tracy
author: Maddy G.

description:
Wanted to give an update. I left a response through JackListens.com, and the manager of the store contacted me the next day to apologize for the situation and to regain my business.

I got to hand it to any business that apologizes for their mistakes. That's pretty great service, I'm definitely willing to forgive if they're willing to admit fault on a mistake.
author: Joe B.

description: Idk I kinda like jack in the box it's greasy as hell but it's cheap and open hella late, this one is always crowded tho
author: Joe Y.

description: This place is very average. Granted it is a jack in the box and we visited at 12:45am, they completely messed up our order. We ordered 2 tacos in addition to our other food and were charged for 4. We didn't get any tacos in our bag. On top of everything, they gave us 20 taco hot sauce packets for our 0 tacos.
author: Avanti K.

description: Hard to give a positive rating for a place that has a one day burger promotion, that is out by your arrival at 8AM!  Guess I should have been there at 6 in the morning but one wonders if they only had one or two burgers available for the promotion.  I am unlikely to take the effort to return.  They did not have the burger but I had a chance to look around and even by fast food standards, it struck me as dirty.  One might understand if there were lines out the door but it was 8AM and the place had maybe 4 people eating breakfast not burgers.  I have never had a Jack In The Box.  Guess I never will.  Ps if you need to use the restroom (like washing your hands!!!!) it will set you back a quarter.
author: Vickie B.

description:
The food here is standard for Jack in the Box although sometimes the fries can get a little stale and that's OK, I know what to expect from this place. What I don't expect is the sub-par customer service. 

I won't be back.
author: Justin S.

description: i would give this 5 stars but the problem i have is that they let anyone off the street get a drink. as i was waiting for my order 2 homeless men came in walked right up to the drink machine & no one said anything!! here i'm paying for my meal & they get away with a free drink!!!
author: Monica D.

description:
For the most part, I am a fan of this establishment.  The food is tasty, inexpensive, and they are open 24/7.

However I have noticed the burgers keep getting smaller, and smaller.  In the past year I would guess the burgers have shrunk by at least   therefore making the burgers more expensive.

I would much rather pay a bit more and have the burger go back to the size they use to be.

Favorites;
Ultimate Cheese Burger + Lettuce, Tomatoes, Onions, and Pickles
Grande Sausage Breakfast Burrito
Extreme Sausage Sandwich
author: Wayne G.

description: The food ia super oily the bag is practically dripping. But its good ya know jack in the box got the goods at 3am. Kinda overpriced for a fast food place
author: Mahima D.

description: It's the only fast food that's open in the Richmond after the bars close. If you want to beat the crowd better get here before 1:30am otherwise come in, order some tacos and people watch.
author: Tom R.

description:
Surprising! Or is it?  It still is American fast food business. I had gotten violently ill off of their competition as I call them with my 'Nome de plume' McDiarrhoea. Four times I had gotten food poisoning (or some gastro enteric allergic reaction from chancing Micky D. Three in San Francisco (two at Haight and Stanyan location alone) and one in southern California -- my first initial reaction - somewhere in Riverside. (All within California).

But this was first at one of their competition, Jack in the Box Inc. that I wound up sustaining a similar scenario.

It was late, I was out on Geary Blvd, when I was looking for something still open. I found Robert Oscar Peterson's Jack in the Box. I went in and ordered their premium burger 'Hella Peño Munchie Meal'.  It did not take very long and the next moment, I sat down as it was late and not crowded.  Admittedly, it tasted quite good. I was pleased... until...uh...

I left and was going to walk home as I lived only ten streets east from there. So I walked to Anza, the next road south from Geary Blvd.  I got to Anza and turned left and half way down the block, I suddenly felt weird. My stomach was in knots and offering me pain. I felt nauseous, and a moment later as I only had gotten worse, I up-chucked it all up and out of me. After moving along still feeling quite listless and malaise, I threw up again with less content.

I continued on until I got to Second Avenue, when I made a right turn (south towards Balboa St.). Immediately I got this VERY strong abdominal pain and thought I was going to burst!  I was scared and thoughts of ER time were nigh. Then I felt a 'shifting' down there in my lower gut, and suddenly realised that I had to find a toilet ASAP or PDQ! I had a full block and half yet to go before getting back home, but my gut would not make it!

Then the worst case scenario had become reality: I had experienced a forced defecation of this hot lava that shot out into my clothes and onto the pavement!  I indeed had a diarrhoea accident -- just a block and a half from where I lived! It was stinky, stinging as it pulled at my skin trapped in my clothing, well... I shall spare you the full details, but just to say that I was one stinking foul mess!  FORTUNATELY save but some street lighting, it was after sundown, so I was not so visible.

I got home and called 911 and asked for medical advice. They asked if I needed an ambulance team to come out, but I declined the ambulance but they did come out to check me out. Fortunately I was okay and was found that I was in no need of going to ER.  I was told that I was sustaining a moderate to severe reaction to food poisoning but that since I vomited, most of the toxins were out of me (same as the 'other route' as well).

I only illustrate this as to show the gravity of these corporate fast food places.  After my little incident that evening, I feel it is only fair and my responsibility to warn others of patronising either McDonalds or now Jack in the Box as well. The food is of very low standard and practically unsafe!  I am surprised that this has not been reported by now and that the Department of Health of the C&C of San Francisco has not revoked the licences of these irresponsible fast food outlets thus causing episodes of food poisonings in their customers!  (Perhaps a little bit of 'payola' taking place between these corporations and the C&C of San Francisco? I just do not know).

So PLEASE BEWARE, that by the consumption of fast food from these leading corporations such as McDonalds and Jack in the Box, is now VERY chancy and at high risk! Unless you don't mind experiencing sudden and urgent vomiting and diarrhoea, if I were you, as San Francisco has over 3'000 restaurants to choose from, to PLEASE find alternatives to fast food!

Thank you kindly!
author: Tatsuhiro S.

description:
I do not care how much you have drunk. How much you have smoked. The food here just plain blows.

Aint much open really late at night...especially after the bars are closing...but I would suggest some Korean wing place that is still open over this place....coco bang is like michael mina compared to this place.

Major PASS.
author: David G.

description: "It's pretty bad the water is bad" - Komei Wang. Cute effort tho. Nice food good convenience.
author: Justin N.

description:
Don't waste your money. Don't put your health on the line for this. There are far better places within walking distance of this restaurant where you can get a much better burger drink and fries for roughly the same price.

 I was really hungry walked in and from what I saw I turned around and walked out. I watched 1 customer pay over 10 dollars for a burger meal,  and when he got it and look depressed, you can almost feel him wanting to return it. Do yourself a favor and keep driving to Burger King 5 blocks away or turn around and get a burger at Joes ice cream either way you'll get your money's worth and the food will be much better.
author: Edward P.

description:
One of the only 24/7 fast food with an open lobby in the city. You can eat in overnight, the floor stunk like bleach the one time I was there and they had the door open so it was freezing, but hey. It's an option. And at least it was clean.

Maybe on a weekend there's drunkies but on a weeknight it's abandoned except for some to-go traffic. Too far out from all the bars and clubs I suppose. But it's a short walk from the 38 Scurrilous Gurrilous and that one Owl line that goes in some giant loop around the city ... 91 or something? I forget.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
This is the worst slop stop. Ordered the Jr bacon cheeseburger. 
Hamburger meat was overcooked probably sitting in some metal
pan for god knows how long. I was unaware this came with some 
weird GMO mayo. 2 bites in and into the bin it went. Not fit for any
living species. Blech
author: Michelle L.

description:
I would like to give a "0" rating if possible. I was about to park and purchase and item inside Jack in the Box, while my fiance was going down the street to purchase another meal. While we were walking out the of the parking lot, an employee started to yell at me and told me that I could not park there, even though I was about to purchase a meal at the store. I tried to explain my situation to him, but he would not reason with me and ended up calling the police. I moved my car immediately, but unfortunately, he has lost my business for that night and possibly the rest of my life. 

I have made it a ritual to eat at this establishment after playing golf at the nearby course. It has almost been a ritual. But this disgruntled employee has made it so that I may have to get my fast food fix at a competing restaurant.
author: Daniel K.

description: Fast friendly and good service. I went to use a 2 free tacos coupon from the 49ers game. I ended up getting that, a jr bacon cheeseburger, med curly fries, chicken nuggets, and an Oreo Shake. 10 bucks for a lot of food. All tasted about right. This is not a drive through. There is a small parking lot. There is limited seating inside.
author: Marty J.

description: Terrible customer service. The staff are rude. And, there always homeless people walk and sit around.
author: Yelp W.

description:
The inside of this Jack In The Box is open late. I came in and ate a late night snack at 3AM in the morning. Great fast food place if you're hungry after a night of partying. 

The workers that were there were super friendly and really energetic even though it was super late at night. There isn't that much seating inside but I was able to sit down and eat. You get a lot of drunk people here if you come that late at night.

I didn't use the bathroom here but I know you need a token to use the bathroom. This is probably because the inside is open all night.

Overall, the food is like all Jack In The Boxes but the workers were really nice and it's awesome that you can eat inside even late at night.

Pros:
-The inside is open late at night
-Workers are friendly

Cons:
-Lots of drunk people here late at night, which is expected
author: Paul U.

description:
Fast Food what do you expect. I come here for convenience when i'm hungry at late nights...almost always done to the way i like it. if not they willing to redo it. 

Thanks for being here!
author: Thomas C.

description: It's 2:00 in the morning, everything is going great until I can't find my curly fries. Ordered 12 tacos, two chicken sandwiches, jalopeno poppers and CURLY FRIES. It's not the end of the world but I love curly fries, so that sucks.
author: Gina B.

description:
2 Midnight Tacos = 3 Days of crippling , bedridden Food Poisoning. 

Never again...
author: Mike L.

description:
this Jack in the Box i've frequented  often decades ago for late night eats. it's still here. there were few options for late night eats then. now there are too numerous to count.

3 stars for the memory and longevity
-probably wouldn't come here again.
author: Victor G.

description:
My very first job was at a Jack In The Box. True story.

With that information in mind, you know my review is above par. Inside track type of stuff. Like, cold war, soviet spy, double agent, Tom Cruise (although he hasn't ever been in an old soviet era spy film) kind of truth.

You wanna know? Can you handle it?

This joint...it's just like every other Jack In The Box. They're all the same. How do you not know this? It's a franchise, dude. A franchise. They're all supposed to be the same. Cheap food that's bad for you, with no glossy customer service ('cause you're not supposed to have any at a fast food joint), high school kids galore, and every once in a while, your local Richmond District vagrant. 

It's Jack In The Box - it's meh, at its best.
author: Darrell L.

description: I gave it 2 stars because you could tell the guy at the register was working his ass off.. As for the rest of the crew... they were shit. my food was prepped like shit. the texture was shit. The tables look like shit and none of them spoke a lick of english. .... so all in all this jack in the Crack was complete shit. except for the homie that took my order. he was cool and was doing the best he could. keep him, and hire a new crew for him.
author: Brazil B.

description: Even for a Jack-in-the-box, this place is pretty bad.  Food was the usual Jack standard and the service is fine.  Here's why it loses a star.  For some reason, they have a fancy new soda machine, but its missing almost all the basic sodas (even Coke and Sprite).  Sometimes, there are random homeless people here too.
author: R L.

description:
This place gets a lot of foot traffic! you wouldnt think so, but one night I sat at the table and stared at the door while eating my jumbo jack meal.. and you wouldnt believe how many people come in and out, and they go out so quickly that's why you dont notice! 

Friendly service, I like the people here. The man , he seems to be the manager, is a kind one too. Smiles and courtesy. 

I feel sorry for fast food chains, as they always get the crazies walking up their allies . Be nice to the people who work here, they have to deal with a lot.
author: Veranna N.

description: Dont go here at night time , food sucks , chicken comes out harder then bricks , not professional at all. One time my burger smelled kinda funny so I just threw it away didnt even eat it . Go to the san pablo damm rd one
author: Rene L.

description:
The "drive-thru" (not really, more like a walk-thru) is open 24 hours - it's just a little patio with an ordering window to be exact.

- It's the only JIB in the city with outdoor seating and a small parking lot.
- VERY small (low ceiling too), compared to most fast food places.
- Junkies and drunks come here at night, so it stinks.
- SF late night dining options are just so sad.
author: Luis C.

description:
You really can't beat the taco deals and curly fries, especially when you're intoxicated from adult beverages ;). 

Jack gets 4 stars for being there when I need him the most. :)
author: Belyn L.

description:
I would give this Jack in the Box a 2.However back in the day this Jack rocked and I would have given it a 3.5-4 stars for fast food fare.But for whatever reason they changed,maybe it's just this particular Jack,the seasoning on the patty which made any of the burgers inedible to me.

Still as long as you stay away from any of the patty burgers you'll be okay since the tacos,chicken and fish burgers and curly fries are still awesome.

Service is also really hit or miss depending on the order taker you get.
author: Ming W.

description: If you use a debit card there ask for ID, since they don't have a thing to type your PIN in. BULLSHIT
author: Matt O.

description:
Sorry Jack in the Box,

I'm older, wiser, a little bit classier. I still go out every weekend, but I just don't crave you anymore.  The after party isn't at Jack in the Crack anymore. It's at ABC Cafe, D&A, or some cutty spot in Chinatown.  Like I said, we classier.  

Plus, it's a little harder to successfully execute a dine and dash at Jack in the Box...
author: Randy N.

description: For those who want to sober up or cheat on their diets, then this jack n the crack is for you. I'm not boasting the quality to be of gourmet level but for drunk food, it's a home remedy. I've been going to this one ever since it opened and before there was yelp. It's always been consistent and rarely disappointed. I only have one gripe for taking away one star. Your soda machine is in desperate need of repair or cleaning. Five times in a row I've got super sweet syrup as the majority of my drink and it tastes yucky! Please fix because it's detouring me from ordering a combo. Other than that, great establishment. (Side note, health food sanitation rating was surprisingly high for a fast food joint)
author: Jas P.

description: Was going to put a negative review since the cashier mixed up my order and left out a burger... but i came back and they offered an extra side of my choice. I worked food service in my youth, and i understand being tired late at night.
author: Joey M.

description: Many of moons have passed since they've served edible food. This place is now more disgusting than McDonald's!
author: Michele C.

description:
A limerick to the box of Jack:

The only good thing about this darned place
Is the convenience of hot food and saving yourself a race
Dodging between crackheads and drunkards galore!
Look out there! It's a fifty cent whore!
But there is fried food here, and that's it's saving grace!
author: Grace Y.

description: I came here for a late night snack on Friday.  This one is much better than the one in the Tenderloin.  The employees were nice and their service was fast.  What more could I ask for from a Jack in the Box?
author: Elena N.

description:
If you sit down at their outdoor tables, you will contract over 9 venereal diseases. Okay you really won't but it looks like you will.

The Indian lady behind the counter is a condiment Nazi. She will charge you for extra ANYTYHING. (Yes, even ketchup.) I have heard that many fast food chains now do this but i've never been charged before. During all my years of this life I have only been charged at this one particular Jack In The Crack for requesting buttermilk ranch for my curly fries.

On any late weekend night, you will find drunken Asian wannabe gangbangers. Be careful, there's usually a fight or two and there has been a shooting here and there. There are ALWAYS homeless people around begging (it's open 24 hours). The parking lot is tiny, you're better off with street parking on the weekends. 

So this place is pretty bad. But when you're inebriated, 2 monster tacos with sour cream, seasoned curly fries with buttermilk ranch and a medium fountain Coke definitely hits the spot...
author: Susy C.

description: I'm usually tolerant of this place because it was easy. Today needed to use bathroom, was emergency and came in asked for key to unlock bathroom. They said it used quarters. Went to the men's bathroom and found a broken coin lock to men's bathroom. Decided, screw it gotta go so unlocked the bathroom. 2 minutes later, Maria, one of their workers knocks on the door and said you gotta use the men's bathroom in a very harsh choice. I told them the lock is broken, she then continues to harass by knocking on the door. Suffice it too say, she ended up showing me how the lock works for the men's. I told them look at the lock. I didn't know it was unlocked and continues to be rough. I told them I'm a repeat customer, you shouldn't treat a repeat customer like this. There was some raised voices as a result. And told them i want to talk to a manager. Apparently manager wasn't there. Point is. You don't give a customer crap for using the women's restroom if the men's lock is broken and they didn't know it. Comes on ppl use some common sense. When you gotta go. You gotta go. I planned to order something after but results of the harassment, forget buying anything. Forget coming back too. Their morning crew really is the worst.
author: Hieu H.

description:
I have a friend who loves this place...why? Most likely because it's cheap.   I can't help but get nauseated from the site and the smell of the place.  It's as if everyone stepped in fresh dogshit and tracked it in to the place. If I want to catch a virus all I have to do is order something then touch my germ infested change.

If you are what you eat, in the case of Jack In the Box you are...

A cheap ass
Gross / Nasty (pick one)
A panhandler
A gastro-intestinal disaster
A homeless gutterpunk
A hooker who smells like feces
Decrepit
Stinkin drunk with nowhere else to go after last call

Sorry for the reality check, but I'd rather go home and bust that pack of ramen open before setting foot in this dumpster.
author: B H.

description:
A very small fast food joint right at the corner and has a 24hr drive thru for the really hungry people that doesn't feel like eating at Mel's after the bars or when video cafe is completely packed.  

This place never has any of the specials that Jack in the Box is promoting on their television commercials. So one day after seeing that they didn't even have the cheese burger, I asked. They have all the specials but they just don't advertise them.

Without knowing, one can easily over spend on what would had been half the price.
author: M C.

description:
This is your every day standard Jack in the Box, though due to its location, it tends to get quite a bit of traffic and the wait can be rather lengthy at times. While there is no drive thru, tons of people pop in and out of this place for a quick bite to eat. I usually never stop by here unless its for a late night snack after a night of drinking. Nothing quite like their tacos and 99 cent Chicken Sandwich to help sober you up quickly.

Since it is opened 24 hours, this particular branch tends to get a bit wild and messy. You get all sorts of people stopping by in here and more often than not, you'll leave with a story. The last time I came here, my friend Allen and I went in to buy some food while our friends waited in the car. Let's just say we watched a guy start spazzing out and end up on the floor. The workers initially just brushed it off as him "fooling around" as I guess this happens all the time but we were almost certain he was having a stroke based off his mannerisms. After a couple minutes of convincing the workers they should call 911, they eventually did so and he was taken out via ambulance. I was shocked that it would take them that long to come to his aid but I'm glad that eventually help came. Not sure what happened to the guy but hope he's alright. Never a dull moment in this Jack in the Box.
author: Gajan K.

description: Clean, fast and open 24/7, just the way I like it. Curly fries por favor. The 99 cent for 2 tacos are probably not recommended.
author: Chuck N.

description:
This Jack in the Box is 15 steps from my new apartment. 15 steps. 15.

Sadly, regret is also only 15 steps away.

Unpacking boxes and setting up my new place, I became famished. I wanted quick and cheap and tasty. I got quick.

I ended up paying $8 for a meal that tasted like feet. The sandwich was nasty, even for fast food standards. Trust me, I didn't think I was stepping into Burger Bar. But even the chemicals and cheese and excessive ketchup couldn't save this abomination of a meal.

Serves me right when there is plenty of fresh, delicious and dirt cheap food in this neighborhood. I'm still tasting my regret.
author: Brittney G.

description:
This place is honestly one star (+1 for the curly fries and strawberry shake and the comedy). 

My friends and I have been here several times late at night and they get incredible traffic. Lots of late night drunchies and munchies are filled up here. On our latest visit, we saw three guys walk out with six large bags of fast food; it was enough to make someone sick just by looking. The food is just like any other cheap fast food joint. They microwave some things and deep fry everything else. The main standouts, but not in a good sense, are that the tacos here are particularly rubbery and they absolutely lather everything in mayo. 

Their one "saving grace" may be their passable service. Considering the situations we show up in, the counter help aren't particularly irritated and do the best they can...

Come for good late night laughs (public groping, teetering drunkards and the occasional anarchistic and angry homeless man), leave with an anticipated stomach ache.
author: Larry Y.

description:
Perfect place to go after hitting up all the bars on GEARY Blvd. Open 24-hours and who can you say no to 2 for $1 tacos?  There are tables outside, but it's usually pretty crowded, so take your food and eat in the car.

They don't make it 'til you order it!
author: Celeste M.

description:
By "made to order" they really mean "warmed up when you're ready"... let's be honest here.

Overall, Jack in the Box -- and any other fast food chain -- is one in which you show up late at night either incredibly hammered or lit, and when you're not, you sit and people watch and then slowly shake your head and feel dirtier by the second -- all the while also being reassured that there's someone worse off than you in life.

I came here the other night around 2:00 am because I was starving and didn't have dinner. As me and my friend, Larry Y., waited in line, the three guys in front of us (all of them higher than a satellite) ordered about $20.00+ of food EACH. The thought alone of that much Jack in the Box made me shiver.. 

I realize that when you're drunk or high, and you get the munchies, you're insanely hungry. You want disgusting, greasy, quick food. But the amount of food they ordered bordered on reckless endangerment. As they all walked out with what seemed like grocery bags full of deep fried heart attacks in the making, I just shook my head and tried not to laugh. I knew that they would be regretting it all in the morning..

Anyways, I ordered after them and sat down to eat while Larry Y. tried out their new blackberry milkshake. We both just people watched and tried not to laugh too hard at the public groping, angry homelessness, and drunk conversations we heard. 

The location itself is small, and the parking lot must fit about seven cars total. Why they have two handicap spots within those seven car slots is beyond me.. I don't think anyone in life, especially a handicapped person, is in a rush to park as close as possible to an ensuing stroke called Jack in the Box food.

As I finished my food and walked out, I was thankful that my tires were still on my car and that I had exited without any fist fights or stab wounds. I tip my cap and my new stomach flab towards the people behind the counter. Despite serving frozen greasy death to the masses, they are very patient with the drunk belligerent people that come in.

Of course I'm exaggerating and joking throughout most of this post, but please save yourself the dignity and calories of coming here. Your stomach and ass will thank you in the morning..
author: Sean B.

description:
Oh man...I was longing for a box, since moving out to Jersey. And finally, I had mine. Mmmm...the tacos were just as I remembered them and the spicy chicken sandwich and curly fries did hit the spot. 

This place...I remembered had once been a Tokyo Stop (back in the day)...but I digress. Anyway, beware of the dirty hot sauce and ketchup packets.
author: Tinyee H.

description: This Jack in the Box location is open 24hrs and is like the place to go for a late night dinner. Cheap and decent quality food. It's not the best place to go, but it's one of the cheap places that will fill you up late at night.
author: Steven B.

description:
It's Jack in the Box, so you already know about the food and pricing. 

It's on a corner off of the busy Geary corridor in Richmond, so there's a lot of traffic going on outside. I pulled in with my car, and there was a space available. Beware - the parking is limited, and small. You will need to maneuver delicately.

I had wanted to grub down on my breakfast jack in the restaurant, but there were only a few small tables and they were ALL taken. There is a small patio seating area right outside, but this was a typically foggy, cold, drizzly Richmond district day, so I was having nothing to do with that. They should put up some type of canopy or tent so that people can use that space during the 5 weeks it's not sunny and warm. 

Points for being cheap fast food with parking in an area that doesn't have any of it.
author: J C.

description: If you like the smell of dank to accompany your late night munchies than this location may be for you!  The parking lot hella smelled like weed when we left with our order and it was only after 10.  Super tiny inside & small parking lot..which probably explained the guys parked next to us eating their food in their car & staring at us..eww!  I guess I'm just used to the Jack in the Box by SJSU which caters to mostly students and the occasional bum. But how can I really rate Jack In The Crack?
author: Cat C.

description: Like any other Jack in the Box. But it's open pretty late so there are so many vagrants around. Kind of scary to go there at night. Otherwise it's a nice enough for cheap fast food.
author: Annie P.

description:
I use to work at this Jack in the Box location.  When you order food here, everything is made to order which is a good thing because it's fresh and can be made to how you like it.

During rush hour, it may not be so good.  

One time I was working as a cook along side the manager.  I dropped one of the burger breads on the floor.  Right when I picked it up to throw away, the manager said throw in on the grill.  The customers won't know.  That grossed me out.  

Another time, I was working at the front.  During busy hours, there are usually a bunch of workers in the front, including the cashiers, forfilling orders when they're not taking order.  They usually look at the receipts or monitors to see what they need to pack up.  Often times, sodas are filled and too many cups are filled and not used.  Then I see one of the managers taking the extra cups of soda to the side, opening up the lid, and tasting the soda to see what flavor it was.  Then putting the lid back on, and punching the soda indicator buttons on the lids to say what it was.  That also grossed me out.  I know they let customers fill their own soda now because the fountain drinks are up front for customers to fill themselves.  But keep in mind, the same managers who I use to work with are still working there.  If they don't care about burger buns that fell on the greasy floor to be used again, or tasting what they are serving, who knows what they're doing today.

Also, extra burgers that are cooked can only stay in the warmer for 15 minutes.  They usually stick a sticker on the burger wrapper with the number on it.  Numbers are 1 thru 12 representing the numbers on the clock.  If they cooked a extra burger at say, 12:05, they will attached a sticker with the number "4" on the burger wrapper.  Which means that burger can remain on the heater until 12:20.  Get this... I've seen cooks pull out the stickers and repackaging the burger for their customers.  Just to get orders out quicker.  Another time, a manager took a cooked cheese burger (jumbo jack with cheese) from the warmer that expired, scrapped off some cheese, and repackaged it back as a regular hambuger without the cheese.  Just to saw time because it would take another 5 minutes to cook up a burger patty.  Gross.  Only managers would do stuff like that to save a dime.

I don't have anything against Jack in the Box.  The food is good!  I've been back and bought food from them a handful of times.  Just watch out if you're ordering during rush hour and you see a manage cooking or serving food.
author: Jack L.

description:
After our the drunken debauchery known as NYE, the driver for our car service drove round and round trying to find a spot that was open without ridiculously long lines.  Our first choice was Grubstake, but the line was out the door!  In my drunk and semi-conscious state, I heard we also went to Mel's on Geary, Lucky Penny, and some Korean joint, and then we ended up at Jack in The Box.  

I stayed in the car, but it seemed like an eternity before my friends came back with food.  It was around 3am, but I guess everyone else ended up at Jack, too.  My friends were trying to feed me...I think I had some Jumbo Jack, Sourdough Jack, curly fries and a bite of a fried mac n' cheese ball or something like that.  I don't even know how much I ate because the next thing I knew, I was being dropped off at home.  Maybe I was eating in my sleep.  Too bad the food didn't stay in my system for very long.  Lots of alcohol and Jack just don't seem to mix well...*BARF*

3 1/2 stars to Jack for being open late to feed the drunk party people!!!
author: Patra I.

description:
This IS the legendary Jack-n-the-Box of SF! That's right.. open 24 hours baby.. and with PARKING. Now if the SFPD was smart they'd put a squad car here at midnight..because only after you've finished drinking your 5th pint does a couple of Jumbo Jack with extra mayo and with the burger drowned in ketchup actually sound tasty.  

I remember when I used to come here late at night. It's like a rainbow coalition meeting. You have your clubbers, pub crawlers, homeless and 3rd shifters getting their Jack on. Since the inside is small we were all elbow to elbow forced into a temporary bonding moment that even would make Martin Luther King smile as he watched his dream come true.

But that dream was crushed as they have started to lock their doors after 10pm. That's right folks.. you are now limited to ordering through a walk-thru. If you haven't seen the walk-thru it's a contraption that relies on "The Cube". where you put your money through. "The Cube" protects the employees at Jacks from the hold ups but as long as I remember Jack-n-the-Box carried nasty burgers, fries and tacos... not solid gold bars like at  Fort Knox. 

Anyways I'm not sure where I stole the name of "The Cube". Maybe it's because the apparatus seems to be more complicated than solving a Rubik's Cube http://www.maniacworld.com/rubikscube.htm. If you haven't tried to order from "The Cube" then here's a lesson for you. 

1. No need to scream.. they can hear you fine through the speaker. 
2. At some point you will need to give them money.. "The Cube" has two doors.. one on your side and one on the cashiers side. You open your side first and slide the money in first and then close the door. 
3. The cashier will then open his door and then take your money. 
4. The cashier will then reopen his door and put your change in "The Cube". He then will close his door.
5. You then open your door and take the change. 

I swear to God.. you will screw up this process at least once during the exchange. The cashier will then scream either "You have to freaking close your door before I can open mine" or the other is "Freaking wait until I'm done putting your change through the door before you open yours!". Consider yourself school'd because after I watched everyone do it the first time even I screwed up "The Cube" . 

I have almost always had an interesting conversation outside of Jack-n-the-Crack. Crazy drunks getting out of the bars, homeless guys chatting it up for change or dudes who slept in all day who just need something to get them through the night. I even seen a guy gets really pissed as he couldn't figure out "The Cube" and ended up pulling at the door to the point I thought he was going to break it. That remind me..perhaps I named the walk-thru device after the 1997 movie "The Cube" http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/0/0c/Cube_The_Movie_Poster_Art.jpg.. The tagline to the movie was Paranoia, Desperation, Suspicion and Fear. 

This explains every feeling you'll have eating at the legendary 24hr Jacks
-You must have decided to eat here out of DESPERATION
-You'll be PARANOID that they installed "The Cube" just to frustrate you and other drunks at 3am. 
-You'll be SUSPICIOUS of the shady characters that hang out at Jacks at 2am. 
-Lastly you'll FEAR having the runs the next morning as you know the extra heaping of mayonnaise doesn't look exactly right and they use the extra ketchup in the burgers to hide the fact that the meat is old and has been sitting there for a few hours.   http://www.marlerclark.com/news/jackbox10.htm
author: Dan T.

description: I live a stones throw away from this place and have to say I've succumbed to the 2am drunken urge to slam this shit into my face. It's a mistake every single time. If you eat here I hope you have tampons for your ass.. This place is gross and will make you bleed out of your asshole.. Ugh. Get a real burger not this garbo.
author: Seth H.

description:
I LOVE how they are open 24hrs! 
I LOVE how I live across the street from here! 
I LOVE how drunk party goers can come here and grab some good greasy food. 
I LOVE how I can always suggest coming here and then just walk home instead of driving home!
I LOVE how my friends like coming here everytime I suggest it and they know it's because I live across the street and can just go home right after getting food.

They use to not allow people to go inside after 10 but now they allow people to go inside every hour of the day/night. So cool. This place usually gets packed at night and gets extremely packed around 3ish after the clubs close. 

MmmMMMmm...... my yummy list!
Bacon Ultimate Cheeseburger (1090 cals)
Jumbo Jack with cheese (690 cals)
Sourdough Jack (710 cals)
Jacks Spicy Chicken with cheese (700)
CHEESY MACARONI BITES!!! (220 CALS PER 3)
Stuffed Jalapeno (230 cals  per 3)

All the greasy food is loaded with calories but it's OK since you already had a shitload of calories from all the alcohol you had and you'll probably go home and throw up anyways so eat whatever you want and don't feel bad bout it!
author: Juliane N.

description:
3 stars for their late night bullet proof walk up window.

Minus 1 star for having no drive through when there's bad weather after a night of drunk partying or clubbing in the city and being all hungry.

Minus 1 more star for the occasional bum that might beg you to buy him some food.
author: Chris T.

description: Seven bucks got us two burgers, four tacos, two fries and two sodas. Jeez, these are seriously crappy tacos.  I'd like to say we didn't eat them, but yeah, come midnight they seemed brilliant.  Ewww.
author: Meg W.

description:
I just have to say "Thank You" to Jack for preventing many a hang over.  Although I wouldn't be caught dead eating this shit at any other time, the fact that this place is open during the ungodly hours between 2:00pm (after the club) and 4:00am (even later after the club) have supplied me with the greasiest, yummiest food ever!  Although my brain is not conscious and aware that really what is happening is this:

1)  Alcholol blood levels have risen well beyond the legal limit (My new year's resolution last year was to become a responsible drinker thus, I now take cabs or have other people drive!)
2)  Motor functions have diminished significantly
3)  Ability to make good decisions seriously comprimised

The result being:

1)  I don't look as cute as I did 4 hours ago
2)  I don't care that I just cut in line the big football, steriod taking, giant in front of me that would probably kick my ass if he wasn't drunk, too
3)   I spilled the vanilla shake all over my new $100 jeans- SHIT....
4)  I have no idea how I'm gonna get home
5)  I don't even care what time it is, or how long the line is in front of me...

JUST GIVE ME MY FUCKING CHICKEN FAJITA PITA AND MY SEASONED CURLY FRIES... IM HUNGRY!  

This really is my body telling me I need something fattening to sop up all the alcholol so I can get up in the morning and not feel like SHIT!
THANK GOD FOR INSTINCTS!
author: Jacquie L.

description:
Why five?

+It's open after the bars close.
+They actually have their own parking lot.
+Super conveniently located on Geary in the Richmond.
+Breakfast served any time of day or night.
+Their Steak & Cheddar Ciabatta's run laps around Arby's Roast Beef Big Montanas or In 'N Out Double Doubles - real steak, not ground beef bits.
+Oreo Milk Shakes
+Yes, there's always drunks outside, which means they'll happily serve you. =)
+Did I mention they're still open after the bars close?

And watch this space. Soon, it will host the YELP INSOMNIACS BURGER BINGE.
author: Perci N.

description: Been here a whole lot of times. Never have I been treated as well as Noah and Pusspa (sp?) did tonight. That kind of service will make people come back, especially me.
author: Rikus L.

description:
came here after a club event.  small jack in the box, relatively quick service and typical workers.  maybe 6 tables in the place and pretty crowded for the time of night that I went.  

didn't provide napkins, ketchup, or any other necessary items without asking.
author: Christine K.

description: This Jack in the Box has been satisfying our late night cravings countless times after a long night out. It also helps that it's open 24/7 and I hope it stays that way. The owners and employees are all very nice and patient esp when dealing with their mostly tipsy customers at that hour. Fast food is fast food so I don't have much to say about the quality except I get exactly what I expected - hot burgers and tacos in a flash. If there were other food options at that hour, I'm still not sure if I would pass up going to this spot for some 99 cent tacos. Thank you Jack in the Box for always being there.
author: Nathan L.

description:
Hey, let's give it up for this JITB. How many fast food establishments, or any establishments, ask you how was your visit? 

Base: 3
customer service: +1 for new customer server effort = 4
food: +0.5 for consistency= 3.5
Other:-1 for not having $1 for 2 tacos+1 for "Glad you exist in this neighborhood"=3

Final= 3.5


Note: order to-go; prices higher than most fast food places, but hey, it's JITB; quick, familiar, cheap, a change from all the Chinese rest around here.
author: Shureluck H.

description:
Anyone who rates this place less then 13 stars is insane. People can hate on Jack in the Box for being unkempt, a safe haven for people of the street, and for making you feel like you're in line at a refugee camp late at night, but without this restaurant you people would be so empty. Where else would you go to get those delicious, ridiculously cheap tacos and burgers after a night of margaritas and couscous with Kimberly and Enrique? WHERE?

I challenge all of you to re-evaluate the importance of Jack in the Box in your lives. The next time you take a bite into that delicious Sourdough Jack or the Big Cheeseburger off the dollar menu, treat it like it's your last.

The only reason I give this place 5 stars instead of 34 is because they got rid of the amazingly glorious Big Deal, which gave you 2 tacos, 1 cheeseburger, and a drink for like $2.50. Jack, what were you thinking? When I asked the staff about it, they replied, "No big deal."

=(
author: Edmund C.

description: I just love going out to Jack In The Box. Jack gets it right with all and any dish on the menu. I also love how this restaurant competes with every dish out there, minus italian dishes.  I can order Chinese Spring Rolls and a burger if I feel like it.  Really awesome! :D
author: Patrick W.

description:
This Jack in the Box location has undergone many changes since I've lived in San Francisco. At one time, after 10:00PM, you had to place your order through a window (usually in Spanish). Amusingly enough, I had a multi paragraph unfinished Yelp! review from seven months ago wherein I gave it a 3-star rating, praised this location for its changes in staff and cried out against the sugar-infested smoothies and how I would brave the dangerous Geary/11th Ave. intersection many a drunken night in order to go here. This intersection finally got stoplights a few months ago.

My latest experience of this places haven't been so good. One of the last times I went here, with a friend, we ordered the Sirloin Mini burgers only to find out they had basically cut up the meat from a Jumbo Jack in 1/4's and gave it to us. Was this because we were using coupons? Then, since I obviously don't learn from my mistakes, I went here again and ordered the mini chicken burgers, and that time the buns had been toasted to a crisp. My roommate also got sick from eating at this location.

For what you're paying at this Jack in the Box, you could nearly have a gourmet meal in San Francisco. Yes, you're getting Jacked at the Box!
author: Wilson S.

description: This place is filthy, but it's the best place for late night post-partying drunken eating.  And as long as I get my bacon and cheddar potato wedges I don't care that I have to stand in line with hobos.. as long as they keep their hands to themselves.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Screw you Jack!

You are too close to me and always open.

You make me eat too many tacos and other $1 menu items.

I go here to eat when I don't need to.

Farm on a bun....Jack I love you.
author: Josh L.

description:
24 hours

Craving a late night snack/meal? Where else can you get a deep fried taco at 3am after going to a bar or club. nough said.
author: David W.

description:
Where the hell else you gonna go at 3:30am on a Tuesday night? The one star I give is for the fact that it is open, that is it.
  It is crappy food, as late night fast food tends to be. But it is not fast. You must be prepared to wait. And wait. And wait. And god forbid you want, say, sweet and sour sauce for your egg roll, or salsa or sour cream for your taco's, or even ketchup for your curly fries. That will take some negotiating, and possibly a little begging. I failed. I came home with not a packet of ketchup, let alone taco sauce, to my name.
    It is ridiculous, what one must go through to get mediocre sustenance late at night. But what other options does one have at this hour? The long wait at the way out there Video Cafe? I am beginning to believe taquitos from the Clement 7-11 are more worth while than this Jack-in-the-Crack shit. 
      When will I ever learn?!?

   p.s.

        i just learned, we did not get our fries either. I told them to empty and check the bags before we left. They thought I was being paranoid. Now, no curly fries for anyone.
author: Miss Kae O.

description: One night i was there, i forgot to take my cheesecake but i went back a week later and convinced them and the guy gave me another one for free -  me happy :)
author: Barnie M.

description:
Blueberry french toast sticks!!!

I repeat... blueberry french toast sticks..hell yeah..

Plus gotta love the fact that at 7am i feel like the healthy one there ordering them instead of all the early morning hamburger eaters.. I swear I witnessed a man order 4 cheesburgers for breakfast with the other day..

but of course he substituted coffee for the Coke in the combo.. it is breakfast after all..
author: miqual c.

description:
Dirty. This place needs to be powerwashed, inside and out. I too have succumbed to the lure of late-night fast food. But there's no way I'm sitting down at one of the outside tables. If you go there late, prepare to see actual winos sacked out at the tables. Mad Dog 20/20 making a comeback in the Inner Richmond. Maybe it goes well with the seasoned curly fries.

One time I was starving while driving on Geary and thought one of their Ciabatta burgers would hit the spot. I'm not lying, it did. In fact, I'm giving them a third star for that burger. But the inside of the restaurant was not clean. Trash overflowing in the trash can. The cramped seating area a competition between local retirees, teenagers, and some homeless woman who took the last table and wasn't about to move. I felt badly for the guy who just missed getting that table, looked at the other tables wistfully, thought about asking the woman to move, thought about asking someone at the counter to get the woman to move, then just decided to wait it out, standing while eating his fries.
author: Timothy O.

description:
I was talking the other day about how you know you've gotten old by the way your body reacts to things that you had no problem digesting in your younger years. In our younger years, we'd hit up Jack at all sorts of hours and devour tons of stuff that I can barely think about ingesting today.
But sometimes, late late at night, you make decisions that you regret about an hour later. In this case, a cheeseburger, curly fries, and a coke. Initially, that stuff tasted DEEElicous! But between a half hour to an hour later, I felt it and it was horrible. But I admit, I needed the grease, and when I ate it, it hit the spot. And I'm grown-up enough to accept the consequences of my actions.
So, thank you Jack-in-the Box. You were open and fed me at an ungodly hour when I needed to grease it up.
author: Loli L.

description:
Jack in the Box is one of the worst fast food restaurants in the world. Their food sucks - especially their tacos. Rumor has it the tacos are made from human flesh.

So why even rate this Jack in the Box? It's open late. After midnight the line usually builds with bar hoppers, transients and clubbers. This is one of the few places that IS open late, so if you are looking for a quick fix, go here.

A word of warning: there's a fight here almost every week.
author: Karl K.

description:
Thanks to this Jack location... I discovered it was possible to order breakfast at 3 in the morning. And rediscover it was possible when i found a receipt in my pocket telling me I was there at 3 o clock in the morning. What? Where am I...?

On another note, I've never once been here without hearing something hilarious from other people in line. On one occasion, "Are you sure? Well do you know whose it is? I think you should get tested at one of those vagina doctors, they know better than walgreen's sticks."
author: Sandra S.

description:
It's not that cheap considering it's fast food. Deep friend goodness and open late - this is what you want when you're wastey face :) 

Chicken tenders are good - but still nothing on Lucky chicken tenders (see my review of Lucky grocery store)
author: linda t.

description:
A 24 hour Jack in the Crack in the middle of the city is a sign from god that he truly loves me. My love for THE crack! has only grown after the following meal.

1 Grilled Cheese = 330 Calories, 18 grams of fat

14 Jalapeno Poppers = 1080 Calories, 60 grams of fat

1 Medium curly fries = 420 calories, 24 grams of fat

1 Large Oreo Shake = 1450 calories, 75 grams of fat

Apart from clogging my arteries and earning myself an extra hour of cardio and 500 crucnches at the gym the following day what does it equate to?

3280 calories and 177 gramsof fat and 1 godly epic meal at the Crack!!!oh did i mention a killer heartburn and heart attack?!

But hey at least i went happy!

May such epicness never end! You know i'll go back
author: Tushar V.

description:
I don't think I've been in the actual restauraunt more than 2 or 3 times in my life.  The actual action is outside on the late night creep when they close the actual eatery and open up the late night booth. There you will see a couple of  different types of people: asian clubbers after the club, bums or white dudes in track jackets.  You'll never fail to see one of these types there at any late night hour.

I'm not going to comment on the food cause i'm sure everyone has had it before.  Typical fast food, hits the spot before you go to bed.  Points for the kind of cool window where you get your food.  If you don't close your side, they can't open their side.  Great protection from thieves and i'm sure the glass is bulletproof.

Parking lot is small with about 5 spots.  Since the lot is so tight, you can get into a  few precariously parking mishaps.  My friend's boy hit some other sucka on the bumper but since they were both driving buckets, they both said fuck it and drove away.  Good one.

Also watch out for Bums who don't even ask you for money.  They just seem to enjoy sitting there and spewing out whatever is on their mind.  Pay no attention to them unless you want to buy them a burger.  I actually did see a hot bum fight here a few years ago.  A little shoving here and there but great entertainment value....
author: Jason Y.

description:
This jack in the box lacks a drive thru. Instead, we are given not a walk-thru, but a walk-up-to portion in front of the establishment with a plastic square acting as a mediator for you and the employee damned to work the night shift.

This Jack is notorious for bringing out seedy folk after 2am. Your Local homeless see this as an opportunity...the ghetto asians, drunken white people and lastly, the obnoxious anyones.

Usually takes a few minutes to get your order, but they are good about it. Even with 3 stars, I won't be back.......soon.
author: James J.

description: Great for after a night of partying. The food was fresh and they know how to handle a lot of customers at once.
author: Chris I.

description: Jack in the Box is Jack in the Box, and they are all pretty much the same.  This is probably the closest Fast Food place to my house, so my boyfriend went to get us some yesterday.  I just had two tacos for a dollar, but they were delish!!! They seems much fatter than normal.  He got some breakfast platter that had eggs, bacon, and the cutest little (and delicious) pancakes.  Good ole Jack in the Box.
author: Jill B.

description: Unbelievably ghetto. My family and I stopped here because we were doing the tourist thing by going to the Golden Gate Bridge and Golden Gate Park. For the bathroom, the men's bathroom required tokens, coins, or an employee's card to get in. The women's bathroom doesn't require the same, but there's this stench that I think is alway there. The restaurant itself is very small, but at least they have some outdoor seating. The parking lot is very tiny; I think it can only have 10 parked cars at a time. Service was pretty decent although I would not return here again based on the overall "feel" of the restaurant. There is no drive-thru at this location; although they have a "walk-up" window for late night customers, I believe.
author: Quynh Tram T.

description:
So bad yet so good.  A sourdough jack with curly fries hit the spot.
Could be dangerous now that we're only living a few blocks away.
author: Jenn T.

description:
Possibly the smallest Jack-in-the-Box that I've ever patronized, the 10th and Geary location feels like it was built by the same architect that designed the bar just across the street.  The minimal dining area makes for a tight squeeze, with a row of booths lining the wall just a scant 10 feet or so from the takeout counter.  The staff is no friendlier than the usual crew of your average  Jack in the Box, and the food doesn't deviate much from what you'd expect.

On the other hand, this franchise ain't without it's saving graces. First off, it's got the same "value menu" of buck-an-item munchies that have made J.I.T.B franchises the industry leaders in late-night, low-buck nutrition.  Two-for-a-buck tacos make for a quick snack, and several Jumbo Jacks selling for a buck-and-a-quarter each make for a gut-busting bargain that's unparalleled in the fast-food world.  Secondly, it's the only cheap 24-hour burger joint in the city that isn't completely over-run by street urchins, druggies, panhandlers or ne'er-do-wells.  It's just far enough east of the Inner Richmond's nightlife district to be free of it's influences, but close enough to offer walking-distance convenience while still being a peaceful spot to grab some late-night calories.

The value menu is abound with cheap food, and if you're in the mood to eat with a beer, the Hearth ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/T_1DmtL6KJ6NfKWPBP7OMQ ) is literally 50 feet from the front door.  I've done this combo countless times, and I've never failed to see at least two other instances of Jack-in-the-box bags on the bar.

Any singular blessing this location possesses doesn't by itself doesn't count for much.  But throw all of it's positive traits together and it's chain-store presence seems to be more of a positive attribute to the area than a negative one. It's a 24-hour fast food outlet.  It's in a decent neighborhood, and in close proximity to a nightlife district.  And best of all, it's spitting distance from a neighborhood bar that's take-in friendly.

So if you're looking to grab a cheap bite in the Inner Richmond and hankering for a cheap beer, don't forget those bargain priced  Jumbo Jacks and the nearby convenience of "The Hearth".  It's not glamorous, but hey...it's cheap.  See you there.
author: Mike W.

description: I love curly fries. I don't love the crazy, creepy, dirty, drunk, tweakin' people that hang around late at night when I want a curly fry fix.
author: Maria M.

description:
I usually wouldn't review a fast food joint cause you know what you are pretty much going to get food wise but in order to add it to my late night food list, here we go.....

Food wise, you know what to expect.  Oh wait, did I say that already.  They are 24 hours so ANYtime you need some food, there you go.  But when it hits prime time (btw 1a - 3a), be prepared to wait in line.....
author: Mark W.

description:
I second Jas Y.'s review just before me. I always feel a little unnerved waiting outside the food window with the late night crowd, for all the reasons Jas described. I'll also add that I've noticed this type of crowd at most locations I've passed in the city. But it *is* open late night, and that's always a good thing.

For those who must be new to the Left Coast (the only reason I can think of why you're unfamiliar with this franchise) Jack in the Box is kinda like the way McDonald's or Burger King is the most prolific chain fast food in the rest of the country. But I must say the food is far more delicious than McDonald's and Burger King (perhaps ingredients that are closer to real), and certainly far heartier and filling. The patties and cheese aren't a cartoonishly bright color. And they just come thicker. I do worry about what else goes into it though, as I've noticed that the workers will put your meal together with their bare hands, and the guy who has made mine several times looked as dingy as some of the homeless dudes that hang outside.

Interesting tidbit: a couple of years back Jack-In-The-Box killed about 10 people with e. coli in the burgers. Since then they've made sure to be more careful. While the deaths may make you queasy, rest assured that this time you should be ok. Or make sure they cook everything well done. :)
author: Clar L.

description:
Every hungry drunk college person's dream at the early AM. Cheap, warm, and fulfilling. You just don't realize it sucks because you're still sobering up.

The drunk homeless guys there are a riot also.
author: Irvin David U.

description: JIB charges 99cents for two tacos but this place charges 1.49 why such a big difference.  Recently they put in a lock on the restroom and when I asked for a token they said that everyone has to paid.  This particular JIB also does not offer specials like other JIB so it is embarassing to ask for a special I saw on TV and have them rudely say they don't offer it.  Still good for munchies and in emergencies
author: Laurence C.

description: How is it in a city full of wonderful late night food..I always end up at your drive through at 3am in the morning..maybe it the curly fries sprinkled in crack or the fact I love to watch the people in your parking lot stubble home from a bar...but what ever it is..don't go changing on me.
author: Hadley L.

description:
what the heck? some people gave this place 5 stars? 

AVOID -this place is absolute garbage - AVOID

RIP OFF - first, they're a rip off, you can forget about the 2 tacos for 0.99 - they don't do it here, it's a $1.50. same goes for everything else on the menu

where the fish combo was 2.99 everywhere else (for Lent), this place jacked it up to 4.99 - this franchise is owned by cheapskates - imagine what corners they may cut with the food....

this place is also stinkin filthy, smells and feels like a public restroom at the basement level of a subway station that never sees the light of day.

and that's the least of your worries... watch out for the evening clientele that might follow you out the door and your rip-off $5 fast food dinner might easily become a $105 or $205 dinner, depending on how much cash you're carrying, plus a knuckle sandwich on the side.
AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID
author: Brian F.

description: There is something about eating in a fast food restaurant that has carpet inside that really gives me the creeps. Even when Im shit faced drunk on a Saturday night ordering the all you can eat fried specials im still grossed out.
author: M K.

description:
lookit peoples... i am not proud.  i am not.  nope.  i am a vegan at heart, but i have the willpower of, well, i'll just admit it, if i've been drinking alot, i pretty much don't have any. yes, i have issues about eating meat, and yes i am being very defensive about this, i know, now leave it be.  

ok.  so i had never ever eaten at a jack-in-the-box before, and although i never planned on it, i winded up here at 1am after meeting up (and getting drunk as crunk) with an old college buddy i hadn't seen in 5 years, walking that fragile line of needing to eat or praying to the porcelain gods...  

i had the typical cheeseburger and fries with a coke.  dudes, i don't know what it was but holyfuckingwow that burger tasted GOOD!  (bad me.  bad.  i swear i will only be eating sprouts and quinoa for a week... i swear!!!) the fries also hit the spot.

i think what i liked the most was the atmosphere.  to be in the presence of a place that was more trashed than i was at that point in time was quite fitting and almost quaint.  eating at the tables outside would be like asking for it.  and 'it' could be anything from ruining your clothing to getting bit by a rat to contracting herpes, etc... 

i'd give my experience 3 stars with one extra star for the interesting fools and conversation that went on while waiting fo' da beef.  it pains me to give such a high rating to such a crazy ghetto place, but hey, that's how i feel.

bad me.  bad.
author: Karen K.

description: I live 1 block away from this Jack in The Box and I used to come here at least 1 or 2 times a week, on average(5 Years ago). Now I'd only go here if I was desperately hungry for food. Used to be okay when this store was operated by another owner, but now it is pretty upsetting in terms of food quality and service. It seems as if quality and service aren't their highest priorities anymore.
author: Joseph N.

description: Blah blah blah. Sometimes a bitch needs curly fries & sometimes she needs them at 2:30 am after a bender at 540 Club. Stop judging me. Very extensive menu for a fast food joint. Impressive, I think.
author: Maria D.

description: Who the fuck hates Jack in the box?  10 tacos for $5!  WTF?  Fast food doesn't exist in the city and this is one of the hidden jewels in SF to get fat.  When you eat here order your 10 tacos, 5 jumbo jacks with NO ONIONS (the raw onions here are super raw.  makes my fat mouth stink), 5 breakfast jacks, and 5 chicken sandwiches.  Its only $20!  So Cheap!  The manatee is a hippy vegetarian so whenever she sees fast food she shits a cow.  Unless its this Jack in the Box ultimate breakfast sandwich.  This is her weakness along with sausages.  har har.
author: Fatty A.

description: Too drunk to drive-thru?  You don't have a car and you have a bag on your foot because you lost your shoe so most places won't let you walk in to order 2 tacos with the dollar you just made?  Maybe you're just a glutton for punishment.  Visit this Jack-in-the-box where you can order at a window that is double paned and bulletproof, you must put your mouth close to the speakinghole to order, and the lady behind the transaction box will yell at you if you try to open the little door on your side before she can close the one on hers.  They rarely hose down the tables outside, so the five second rule definitely does NOT apply here.
author: Marjorie B.

description: It is small but has a parking lot.  It is 24 hours too.  Late at nite the building is close and have to order outside.
author: John F.

description:
24 hr Jack in the Box is probably one of the best things about fast food and this one in particular which is the only late night opened thing in the richmond.  they got pretty much everything you need.  you can have breakfast at late night, some bowl, fries, burgers, ciabatta, dessert, what more can you ask for?

My usual is the chicken sandwich, jumbo jack, large fries, 2 tacos, breakfast jack, and hot sauce with buttermilk.  THANKS.
author: Vincent K.

description: Are you hungry at 4am, in desperate need of some greasy food and not afraid to risk your life in the parking lot to get it?  Simply walk up to the double plexi-glass sliding windows, quickly take your order, get your food a few minutes later, and go back home.  It may be the best Sourdough Jack you have ever had in your life.  You'll be happy to be alive.  I couldn't give Jack less than 3 stars and would never give ANY Jack-in-the-Box 5 stars.
author: Scott G.

description: Sometimes you just have a craving for some of their seasoned curly fries, which I admit, I totally love.  I very rarely eat fast food, but sometimes you want something right then.  Although I don't really call this place FAST food.  I know their thing is they don't make it until you order it, but I'm always standing there waiting around for like 30 minutes!  That is NOT fast food.
author: Kris L.

description: This place was packed at around 2am.  My friends and I wanted pizza but this was closer and soju makes me hungry.  I try to steer clear from fast food joints but I have to admit this is a solid spot for a quick, no frills burger before heading home.
author: Sun T.

description: When no where else is open early in the morning besides from this or Video cafe.. I'd pick this. They have good breakfast! And their milkshakes! If Unless I really needed a restaurant to sit and chat, I'd pick Jack in the Box over Video Cafe anyday.
author: Elaine H.

description:
yeah, that's right, one two three four FIVE stars.

i am astonished that all you other yelpers don't share my excitement & devotion to this wonderful fast food establishment!

- open 24 hours (+1 star)
- curly fuckin fries (+1 star)
- 5 minute walk from my apartment (+1 star)
- dollar menu (+1 star)
- offering free water to all the drunkards (+1 star)
- grease (+1 star)
- employees not acting like they hate their lives for working there (+1 star)
- did i mention they are open 24 hours? (+1 star)
- oh & curly fries (+1 star)

so i am actually giving it 9 stars but, sadly, yelp will not allow that. i understand all the low ratings: it's fast food, homeless people like to chill outside, all their food has 98457254 calories as well as 8463 grams of fat, it smells kinda weird, blah blah blah blah. yall need to learn to appreciate that jack can give you your drunken munchies for under $4. betta recognize!
author: Lizzy L.

description: I hate you and your filthy restaurant.  Try cleaning up your corner, or better yet, just leave.
author: Tiffany M.

description: This is the only location I go to buy my Sourdough Jack meal. Yummmmmmyyyy!!!! Haven't been here the past year or so....so I haven't seen "The Cube". But then again I always come before 10pm. They make your burger when you order it so it's fresh. Never had anything wrong with my orders...EVER!!!!

Now don't get me wrong, I love me some jack in the box.  I am giving this place one star because of the fuck up at the counter today who kept fucking up my order.  At one point he told me he changed the order when I could see on the screen that he didn't.  What a dick!  When I got my food It was still fucked up.  All I wanted was a sirloin bacon cheese burger with no mayo.  Is that too much to ask?
author: doug b.

description: I'd group this place with Carl's Jr.'s price wise. I mean, I like that they have the breakfast option during lunch, but the quality of the food is not that great. The croissant I got looked nothing like a croissant and those hash brown sticks had an odd taste. The food was also really greasy. Besides the food, basically sat down and eavesdropped on these two ladies who wore plastic bags for shoes and acted all philosophical by making judgments about Greeks, Jews, and even Chinese people. I wasn't exactly offended, but when they said "Chinese people have no creative spirit," I didn't know how to think because creativity is what I'm all about. Maybe I shouldn't have been offended because I American. I might just come back even though the food sucks.
author: Alex Y.

description: Despite the fact that this Jack-in-the-Box is hella ghetto after hours, I have to admit, that I LOVE a combo #5 (Sourdough Jack) with curly fries and a Coke.  Yes it's fast food, and no, it's not In-N-Out, but whatever.  Curly Fries!  Dip that in some buttermilk house dressing and you're good to go.  I think that would be great if they turned that walk-up window into a drive-through window.  Then I'd give this place 5 stars!
author: Tony L.
